channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nunu.ai raises $6M for AI agents dubbed ‘unembodied minds’ for game testing
item.description: Nunu.ai has raised $6 million and unveiled Unembodied Minds, or AI agents designed for game testing and to control any given body as needed.

item.title: Spotify says it paid $10 billion in royalties in 2024 — but are artists any better off?
item.description: The music-streaming giant has long been the target of criticism from artists about paltry payments, but said it doled out record royalties last year.

item.title: Google unveils open source Gemma 3 model with 128k context window
item.description: Google's Gemma 3 is multimodal, comes in four sizes and can now handle more information and instructions thanks to a larger context window.

item.title: RISE Robotics sets sights on Guinness World Record for strongest prototype arm
item.description: RISE Robotics said its Beltdraulic linear actuator technology will demonstrate power without hydraulic inefficiencies. The post RISE Robotics sets sig...

item.title: Motorcycles, whiskey, gum: How the E.U. is targeting U.S. products with retaliatory tariffs

item.title: This artificial leaf makes hydrocarbons out of carbon dioxide

item.title: This startup just hit a big milestone for green steel production

item.title: Why should I tip servers who earn $20 an hour?
item.description: “It seems the whole point of tipping was to make up for low wages, and that is no longer an issue.”

item.title: Roomba vacuum maker iRobot warns it may go bust, sending stock down 30%
item.description: After its latest financial figures were worse than forecast, the company said there’s “substantial doubt” it can survive another 12 months.

item.title: Sony testing AI to drive PlayStation characters
item.description: PlayStation characters may one day engage you in theoretically endless conversations, if a new internal technology video bares out.

item.description: OpenAI is also making its web search, file search and computer use tools available directly through the responses API.
